wordpressPost.title: WeSpire Employee Spotlight: Andrew Borstein
wordpressPost.content:
Any great organization requires outstanding people working together to fulfill that organization’s mission and vision. At WeSpire we are extremely fortunate to have a number of amazing colleagues, all working to bring purpose to employees at companies large and small around the world.

This is why every month on our blog in 2016 you’ll find us shining the spotlight on one member of the WeSpire team. It’s an ongoing glimpse into the workforce behind the most powerful employee-engagement platform on the market today. You’ll know everyone in short order!
First up, please meet Andrew Borstein, Software Developer on WeSpire’s Engineering team.

Q: What are the top five most-used apps on your phone?
A: Chrome, Inbox, Facebook, Google Maps, Slack
Q: What do you appreciate most about your childhood?
A: My parents’ unconditional love. They were my biggest champions no matter what I wanted to do or who I wanted to be.
Q: Tell us about your favorite teacher/coach/adult figure growing up. Why did they inspire you then, and what have you realized about them now.
A: My band director in high school, Mark Colozzi. He built an incredible music program from scratch that has endured for decades and inspired a lot of students to make their own careers in music. I realize now how hard his job was, especially now that the state is cutting funding and his proud program is really suffering.

Q: You have to go on vacation for two weeks, all expenses paid. Where to?
A: Somewhere tropical and off the beaten path, where I can do as the locals do.
Q: If you were in charge, what would you fix?
A: I would make people confident enough to trust in their own capacity to create morality, and then put treat each other well at the top of the list.
Q: What’s the best BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal) you ever heard of, and whose was it? (examples, for inspiration)
A: Going to the moon! That was someone’s BHAG, right?
Q: When you’re at work, what’s the most interesting opportunity you have to solve a BHAP (Big Hairy Audacious Problem)?
A: As a team player, allowing everyone to conquer more of their BHAPs; turning every small, discrete problem into an opportunity to make an institutional, systematic improvement.
Q: If you could hire a personal assistant tomorrow, what three questions would you ask him or her in the job interview?
A: Why are you interested in this position? Why do you think I need a personal assistant? How would you answer the first question from this list?
Q: What, if anything, is too serious to be joked about?
A: Nothing. Anything is up for grabs as long as it’s in the right company, in the right place, and at the right time.
Q: What’s your favorite new vocabulary word?
A: Bucolic.
Q: What’s your favorite meal you made recently?
A: Huevos rancheros with homemade mango salsa and fresh avocado.
Q: Signature cocktail?
A: Can I get a beer, please?
Q: Greatest extravagance?
A: A cookie sandwich made with two chocolate chip cookies with frosting in the middle, from Whole Foods.
Q: Ideal pet?
A: My cat Sunny pretty much hits that on the (wet) nose.
Q: What’s your favorite way to save money?
A: Up-cycling! Inheriting stuff from other people or buying things used.
Q: What would constitute a perfect day for you?
A: No obligations, except the ones that I could really knock out of the park without much effort. An opportunity to do something that makes me go, Weeeeeeee! A chocolate chip cookie. A good movie. A nap with a pet or two. A good beer. Slippers.
Q: If you were to die and come back as a person or thing, what do you think it would be?
A: A mix-tape from the early 90’s.
Q: If you could wake up tomorrow having gained any one quality or ability, what would it be?
A: Decisiveness/the ability to make decisions more easily and feel more confident about them ‘ a stronger gut.
___________________
Mad lib bio snapshot:
Andrew Borstein was born in Providence, RI. He launched his career at RHD-RI in Pawtucket, RI and his favorite boss/manager has/had a habit of asking really awesome questions, laughing nervously, and bursting into song with an acoustic guitar. Andrew joined WeSpire in May, 2015, having previously completed the Full-Time Web Development Program at Startup Institute Boston in April. In his spare time he likes to teach web design, play pool, and DJ 90’s hip hop. His colleagues at WeSpire have no idea that he loves major 7ths.
